comment: Prof. Mixson-Brookshire was fantastic! There are a bunch of Excel assignments to do, but if you get stuck she will help. There is no midterm or final exam. The quizzes are the Excel assignments each week and you have a group project which isn't hard to do, at all. She's very responsive and I would definitely take her again.

Attendance isnt mandatory, but there are marked days on the syllabus when you need to be there for a grade. 3 exams and an optional final exam, no webcam or LDB on any. Group project will be frustrating, but months to finish it. Also significant extra credit opportunities. Highly recommend this professor, great lectures and course content/structure

one of the best professors ive had so far. She is so nice and cares about her students, very understanding if you have an issue come up she'll help you solve it. Her management class is so easy its hard not to pass. attendance is not mandatory but there are a few in class exercises that count towards your grade & she tells you the dates of those

I highly recommend people to take this professor. There are 2 exams and a couple of quizzes, all of which are easy and have no lockdown. There are also discussion posts, which are easy and help us understand the subject matter. There is one group project, but it was not too hard. She gives lots of time for the assignments, so I never felt rushed.

Professor Mixson-Brookshire is AWESOME! Her course schedule is basically BI-weekly assignments. You can do them at your own pace so lots of the time I was WAY early in her class. Quizzes, discussions, and 2 exams but NOTHING on lockdown. Group project is also broken up into sections so that helps. THE FINAL IS A DISCUSSION POST, TAKE HER!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Amazing! She genuinely cares about teaching and wants to help you succeed. Her assignments are easy if you review the reading and her notes. Tests are straight from the homework. I am taking her for another course because I liked her so much!

Very good professor I believe. Lots of reading from the textbook that is pretty boring. I believe the professor really cares that you learn the material. Good communication, fair grader. 1 Group project, groups assigned and pretty straight forward on what's required. No lockdown.

Very simple class, discussions, and quizzes over each module so 6 each. You can work at your own pace, some people finished the class within a month. There is one group project that was simple; just make sure to actively participate. The 2 tests were pretty easy and she provided an optional 3rd test to replace the lower test grade.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: There are 7 quizzes, 7 discussion posts, 2 exams & 1 group project. Make sure to be an active participate for your group project. Overall easy class. I loved that I could work ahead & complete quizzes and discussion posts early in the semester. Final exam can replace lowest exam score. If you complete work on-time you should get a good grade.

I took Prof Brookshire online, so I never really got a sense of her as a person. however, she came off as caring and gave opportunities for extra credit. Has all the deadlines posted and criteria is clear. Easy grader but no late work accepted. As long as you do the assignments on time, you'll make an A.
Very easy grade but DO NOT miss assignments, papers, or tests (test days you have no class, but have a test online the same day) she offers a little extra credit, and is a great teacher.

I loved this class! Professor made the class very easy and approachable. She wants you to succeed and learn. A clear schedule of all events and assignments is provided at the beginning of the semester. Read the textbook! She WILL NOT accept late work so stay on top of it! This is a incredibly easy A if you put in the work.

I took this class online and it was extremely easy. Had a quiz every week, discussion every month, 3 tests, 1 project, and 2 small writing assignments. There were moments where I actually forgot I had this class tbh. Professor is sweet, easy to contact, and an easy grader. 10/10 recommend taking KSU1101 w her online!!! Seriously easy A!
rating_tags: Tests? Not many--EXTRA CREDIT--Would take again

comment: chapter quizzes: you'll be fine if you read the chapters 3 tests + 1 more that can replace your lowest test grade 2 articles (write 2 paragraphs about an article from the ksu newspaper)+ 1 more for extra credit 1 basic career powerpoint 4 monthly discussions (super easy) Super easy if you like/are familiar with online classes.

Took her online. SUPER easy! Gives you 100 if you do the assignment. You can basically skim the books to pass the tests/discussions. DOES NOT ACCEPT LATE WORK. EVER. But still very nice and helpful otherwise! Would definitely recommend taking her online!

So easy! I transferred from another college and was not interested in taking the seminar but I decided to do it online and as long as you do everything she says, you'll get a 100 on all assignments. She's really nice too and it's easy to get ahead because it's online.

if you're taking and KSU seminar class, TAKE IT ONLINE. the in-class class is way too serious to be learning how to study, and the hybrid class is double the work. Professor's online class was very easy. she has clear details and cares about her students, even those she's never seen.

Online class. Teacher is absolutely horrible! Does not accept late work i.e. (I came down with the flu and was in the hospital when i needed to submit a paper, and she gave me a zero because it was "late"!!!) Very inconsiderate and unthoughtful. Would not recommend this teacher to anyone!
Had her summer 2010.  Best math teacher, clear, helpful and wants you to succeed!
